entry.title: Combined summary - question about ProcessMessage()
entry.summary: The email thread revolves around a specific line of code in the main.cpp file on Github's Bitcoin repository. The function ProcessMessage() contains a line of code that checks if the size of a vector called vAddr is 1000, and if it is, the function returns. The purpose of this line of code is to flag a peer as having no more addresses to learn from, and a previous check ensures that peers sending more than 1000 addresses are disallowed to prevent flooding.One question raised in the email thread is whether the variable pfrom->fGetAddr can be true only if the size of vAddr is 1000. However, the answer to this question could not be found in the list archive, and further investigation may be required to understand how this variable relates to the vAddr vector.Overall, there seems to be a concern about the behavior of the ProcessMessage() function and how it interacts with the vAddr vector and the pfrom->fGetAddr variable. The discussion concludes with a link to a book about graph databases, which may be useful for further investigation.
